findings.title: Swap fees can be bypassed using redeemMasset
findings.description: Traders can perform fee-less swaps by providing liquidity in one bAsset, followed by calling redeemMasset() to convert the resulting mAssets back into a proportional amount of bAssets.

findings.title: Users can collect interest from SavingsContract by only staking mTokens momentarily
findings.description: A user who deposits shortly before the end of the 30 minutes timeframe will receive credits at the stale interest rate and can immediately trigger an update of the rate and withdraw at the updated (more favorable) rate after the 30 minutes window.

findings.title: Internal accounting of vault balance may diverge from actual token balance in lending pool
findings.description: The internal accounting of vault balance may diverge from the actual token balance in the lending pool due to incorrect assumptions about deposited amounts and potential fees, leading to temporary correctness property violations.

findings.title: Missing validation in Masset._redeemTo
findings.description: In function _redeemTo the collateralisation ratio is not taken into account unlike in _redeemMasset, allowing an attacker to redeem a disproportionate amount of assets.

findings.title: Removing a bAsset might leave some tokens stuck in the vault
findings.description: In function _removeBasset, there is existing validation to make sure only 'empty' vaults are removed. However, this is not necessarily sufficient since the lending pool balance may be higher than the vault balance due to the 30 minutes time span between interest collections.

findings.title: Unused parameter in BasketManager._addBasset
findings.description: The _measurementMultiple parameter is always StableMath.getRatioScale() (1e8) and there is unnecessary range validation code.

findings.title: Unused event BasketStatusChanged
findings.description: It seems like the event BasketManager.BasketStatusChanged event is unused.

findings.title: Assumptions are made about interest distribution
findings.description: The extrapolation assumes that the interest is paid out frequently and continuously, which might lead to rejection of less frequent payouts.

findings.title: Assumptions are made about Aave and Compound integrations
findings.description: The code makes several assumptions about the Aave and Compound integrations which might lead to unintended behavior in the system.

findings.title: Assumptions are made about bAssets
findings.description: The code makes several assumptions about the bAssets that can be used. A malicious or malfunctioning asset contract might violate those assumptions.

findings.title: Unused field in ForgePropsMulti struct
findings.description: The ForgePropsMulti struct defines the field isValid which always seems to be true and can potentially be removed to simplify the code.

findings.title: BassetStatus enum defines multiple unused states
findings.description: The BassetStatus enum defines several values that do not seem to be assigned in the code.

findings.title: Potential gas savings by terminating early
findings.description: If a function invocation is bound to revert, one should try to revert as soon as possible to save gas.

findings.title: Discrepancy between code and comments
findings.description: There is a discrepancy between the code at BasketManager.sol:L417 and the comment at BasketManager.sol:L409.

findings.title: Outdated Solidity version
findings.description: The codebase is using an outdated version of the Solidity compiler.
